chunks.en: How many people played the online game 'é—®é“' (Way of Tao) when they were young?
I was introduced to 'é—®é“' in elementary school. Back then, my older brother, a young internet addict, got me hooked, and I was totally engrossed.
Later, I would save my pocket money to buy a 10 yuan game card, which made me incredibly happy.
After watching 'Ne Zha Reborn' during this year's Spring Festival, many Taoist myths about the Investiture of the Gods reminded me of all sorts of things about 'é—®é“' back in the day.
So I started a nostalgia server. Anyone want to join and have some fun? It's a purely public-service version 1.60, and you get 2 billion ingots (equivalent to 20 million RMB) at the start.
I did a small-scale test on the L site next door, and everything is running smoothly so far.
But I want to ask if I can post this on V2EX. If it violates the rules, I won't. If it doesn't, I'll post the QQ group number in the postscript.
I suggest not making it public. Our company has people dedicated to cracking down on private servers, and they've sent quite a few people in ğŸ¤£.

chunks.en: I played it for a while. I felt that the graphics weren't as good as Fantasy Westward Journey, so I played Fantasy Westward Journey later. I remember I was in the Longpan Taishan district, playing as Jinxi, and I caught a big turtle, I think.
@mmmao #1 Fellow Taoist, once a fellow Taoist, always a friend.
@zhangfeiwudi #2 Back then, everyone had a big turtle. It was a very cost-effective vitality pet in the early days, and the character dealt damage.
I remember I still have a level 155 DT account in Fantasy Westward Journey. I'll see how much it's worth on CBG sometime.
Nostalgic for the gourd mount.
@imherer #5 My good friend back then played Fantasy Westward Journey, and we argued every day about which was the light of domestic turn-based games, hahaha.
BTW, looking at it now, Fantasy Westward Journey is more successful. The market development is much healthier. 'é—®é“' has become increasingly disgusting to ordinary players since the coupons.
